original: HALLGREN, Paul Johan Vilhelm, Direktör, Oslo, f Gullholmen, Bohuslän, 8/2 86 av disp G R H o Anna Esping, gm (2) Margaretha Scharp. Mog.ex Karlstad 04, KTH (E) 05— 08. Anst v Telegrafvkf 09, e.o. linjeing Sundsvall, Sollefteå o Malmö 10—16, linjeing Malmö 17—20, byråch i Telegraf styr 20—30, gen.-manager f Skand i Standard Electric konc fr 31 samt adm dir i Standard Telefon og Kabelfabr A/S Oslo fr 33. Styr.led i AB Standard Radiofabr i Ulvsunda o Standard Electr A/S i Kphmn. Led Sv Tekn.frn. Resor: Belg, Engl, Frankr, Ital, Tyskl, USA. KVO2kl, RNO, KFinlVRO, RNS:tOOlkl.
translated: HALLGREN, Paul Johan Vilhelm, Director, Oslo, born in Gullholmen, Bohuslän, on February 8, 1886, to parents G R H and Anna Esping. Married (2) to Margaretha Scharp. Previously married in Karlstad in 1904. Attended KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) from 1905 to 1908, specializing in electrical engineering. Employed by Telegrafvkf in 1909, serving as an assistant lineman in Sundsvall, Sollefteå, and Malmö from 1910 to 1916, and as a lineman in Malmö from 1917 to 1920. Worked as a bureau chief in the Telegraph Board from 1920 to 1930. Became the general manager for Skand in Standard Electric Corporation from 1931 onward, and the managing director of Standard Telefon og Kabelfabr A/S in Oslo from 1933. Served as a board member in AB Standard Radiofabr in Ulvsunda and Standard Electr A/S in Copenhagen. Member of the Swedish Technical Association. Traveled to Belgium, England, France, Italy, Germany, and the United States. Knight of the Order of Vasa, Officer of the Royal Norwegian Order, Knight 1st Class of the Order of the White Rose of Finland, and Knight of the Order of the Polar Star (Sv: Riddare av Nordstjärneorden).

structured.name: Paul Johan Vilhelm Hallgren
structured.description: Director Paul Johan Vilhelm Hallgren was born on February 8, 1886, in Gullholmen, Sweden. He was married to Margaretha Scharp. He attended the Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm from 1905 to 1908, specializing in electrical engineering. Throughout his career, he worked for Telegrafvkf, serving in various positions across different locations. From 1931 onward, he held the position of General Manager for Skand in Standard Electric Corporation and became the Managing Director of Standard Telefon og Kabelfabr A/S in Oslo from 1933. He also held board positions in AB Standard Radiofabr in Ulvsunda and Standard Electr A/S in Copenhagen. Paul Hallgren was a member of the Swedish Technical Association and traveled extensively to Belgium, England, France, Italy, Germany, and the United States. In recognition of his contributions, he received various honors, including being knighted and receiving orders of merit from Sweden, Norway, and Finland.
